original_solution_mapping.L1: If the 12 students had shared the 108 oranges, each student would have gotten 108/12 = <<108/12=9>>9 oranges
original_solution_mapping.L2: But 36 were removed so there are 108-36 = <<108-36=72>>72 oranges left
original_solution_mapping.L3: So 12 shared 72 for each to get 72/12 = <<72/12=6>>6 oranges
original_solution_mapping.L4: This is 9-6 = <<9-6=3>>3 less than they would each get if they did not have to throw any orange away.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2119.
    Returns: the number of oranges less each student will get.
    """
    # L1
    initial_total_oranges = 108 # 108 oranges
    num_students = 12 # 12 students
    oranges_per_student_initial = initial_total_oranges / num_students

    # L2
    bad_oranges = 36 # 36 of the oranges were bad
    remaining_oranges = initial_total_oranges - bad_oranges

    # L3
    oranges_per_student_after_removal = remaining_oranges / num_students

    # L4
    oranges_less_per_student = oranges_per_student_initial - oranges_per_student_after_removal

    # FA
    answer = oranges_less_per_student
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: If the {num_students} students had shared the {initial_total_oranges} oranges, each student would have gotten {initial_total_oranges}/{num_students} = <<{initial_total_oranges}/{num_students}={oranges_per_student_initial}>>{oranges_per_student_initial} oranges
But {bad_oranges} were removed so there are {initial_total_oranges}-{bad_oranges} = <<{initial_total_oranges}-{bad_oranges}={remaining_oranges}>>{remaining_oranges} oranges left

So {num_students} shared {remaining_oranges} for each to get {remaining_oranges}/{num_students} = <<{remaining_oranges}/{num_students}={oranges_per_student_after_removal}>>{oranges_per_student_after_removal} oranges

This is {oranges_per_student_initial}-{oranges_per_student_after_removal} = <<{oranges_per_student_initial}-{oranges_per_student_after_removal}={oranges_less_per_student}>>{oranges_less_per_student} less than they would each get if they did not have to throw any orange away.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: If the 12 students had shared the 108 oranges, each student would have gotten 108/12 = <<108/12=9>>9 oranges
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: But 36 were removed so there are 108-36 = <<108-36=72>>72 oranges left
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: So 12 shared 12 for each to get 12/12 = <<12/12=1>>1 oranges
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: This is 9-1 = <<9-1=8>>8 less than they would each get if they did not have to throw any orange away.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'num_students' (value: 12) was used instead of 'remaining_oranges' (value: 72).
